header.div: Complete the sentences by choosing the word or phrase which best fits each gap.

ol.li: In many cases, if both parents did not work, the family should will would not be able to manage financially.
The introduction of laws allowed allows allowing police access to private phone lines and e-mail correspondence would pose a threat to civil liberties.
Many school leavers, denied denying deny even the hope of a job, eventually fall into bad company and may even resort to crime.
In my view, the technological development which ... who has truly destroyed community spirit in today's society is television.
In all certainty possibility likelihood , people will be even less involved in their communities in twenty years' time than they are now.
Increasing crime rates stem from have given rise to are due to to feelings of insecurity and a tendency for people to stay indoors more than they used to.

Nowadays, anybody with a television or a personal computer and an Internet connection knows more about events on the other side of the world than those these they taking place in their own neighbourhood.
Courts need to impose harsher sentences on convicted drug traffickers because of so that in order to others are deterred from dealing in drugs.

A few decades ago most single-parent households consisted of divorced mothers and their children, consequently furthermore whereas nowadays a significant proportion consists of mothers who have never married.
I am of the opinion agreement favour that the long-term unemployed who live off social security benefits should earn their keep by doing work for the community.
If more parents have brought bring brought their children up to respect other people's property, our cities would not suffer so much from vandalism and graffiti.
Homelessness is still a problem even in countries which where that social security benefits are available to all.
I am convinced that increasing levels of delinquency and anti-social behaviour among children today lead to bring about are due to poor parenting.
Professionals such as teachers, doctors and lawyers, that who ... in the past exercised unquestioned authority and influence, no longer enjoy the same respect in our society.
Although Despite In spite of their efforts, no government has yet found a satisfactory solution to the problem of unemployment.

Current social trends including rising divorce rates, falling birth rates and growing numbers of single people living alone mean that the typical family household well could just could could well be a rarity in the future.
The declining number of people vote voted voting in general elections clearly demonstrates the general apathy present in today's society.
Unfortunately, characteristics like example such as discourtesy, aggression and self-centredness are becoming increasingly common among young people today.
It is highly unrealistic unlikely impossible that governments will be able to continue providing pensions for the growing population of over 65s.
Traditionally, the old and infirm were looked after by younger members of their own family. However Whereas Although , in many societies today this is no longer the case.

section.p:
1. would: This is the correct answer.
will: This is a hypothetical statement. The 'conditional' form of the verb is needed here.
should: Another modal is needed here.

2. allowing: This is the correct answer.
allowed: The present participle is needed here.
allows: This is a kind of contracted relative clause using a participle verb form.

3. denied: This is the correct answer.
denying: The past participle is needed here.
deny: This is a kind of contracted relative clause using a participle verb form.

4. which: This is the correct answer.
who: The missing pronoun does not refer to a person.
... : The pronoun can only be omitted if it refers to the object of the verb in the relative clause.
5. likelihood: This is the correct answer.

6. have given rise to: This is the correct answer.
are due to / stem from: What follows the gap is the result, not the cause.

7. those: This is the correct answer.
they: You need a plural pronoun.
these: You need a pronoun which refers to something distant (on the other side of the world in this case).

8. so that: This is the correct answer.
because of: What follows this gap is the result, not the cause.
in order to: This phrase needs to be followed with a verb in the infinitive.

9. whereas: This is the correct answer.
consequently / furthermore: What's missing is a connecting word which emphasises the contrast between these two facts.
10. opinion: This is the correct answer.

11. brought: This is the correct answer.
bring / have brought: What's needed here is the 'conditional' form of the verb, which shows that the statements are hypothetical. The form is 'would + past participle'.

12. where: This is the correct answer.
that / which: The missing pronoun refers to a place.

13. are due to: This is the correct answer.
bring about / lead to: What follows that gap is the cause, not the result.

14. who: This is the correct answer.
that: It is not possible to use the pronoun 'that' in a non-defining clause like this one.
... : It is not possible to omit the relative pronoun in a non-defining clause like this one.

15. In spite: This is the correct answer.
Despite: 'Despite' isn't followed by 'of'.
Although: 'Although' is followed by a verb clause, with subject and verb: 'Although the government have made efforts.'
16. could well: This is the correct answer.

17. voting: This is the correct answer.
voted: The present participle is needed here.
vote: This would need a full relative clause: 'who vote'. Instead, a participle clause is used here.

18. such: This is the correct answer.
example / like: An example is being given here, but notice the word 'as' after the gap.

19. unlikely: This is the correct answer.
impossible: Intensifying adverbs such as 'very' or 'highly' can't be used with 'impossible'. Either something is impossible, or it isn't .

20. However: This is the correct answer.
Although / Whereas: Notice that this is the beginning of a new sentence with only one main clause. 'Although' and 'Whereas' are used to join two clauses together, so they can't be used here.
